Description: 1940s H. Gerstner & Sons 7 Drawer Machinist Tool Chest. 18 1/8 inches long, 8 1/2 inches wide and 12 1/2 inches tall. It is constructed of oak and covered in a leather like material, the handle is covered in leather. There are 7 drawers of various sizes. 6 of the drawers are lined with original green felt, the top drawer on the left side has been re-lined with galvanized metal. The drop down door on the front is lined with original green felt as well. All of the nickle plated hardware is intact with some minor scratches and some patini. The base hardware for the latches are all engraved with H. Gerstner & Sons. There are some minor tiny tears in the leather like covering on bottom front corners and bottom edges from normal use as well as some minor fading in places. Also some tiny splatters of what looks to be white paint. The chest belonged to a WWII veteran and was used daily in his civilian job until he retired. The chest was well taken care of and is in near excellent condition. Unfortunately we were not able to locate the key.
Title: 1940's H. Gerstner & Sons Machinist Tool Chest
